decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to power up Death's Shadow and other synergistic creatures, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also leverages cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to dig for key pieces and maintain card advantage. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while using removal spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt to control the board.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells and counterspells while utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes card draw and graveyard interaction to maintain card advantage and answer threats efficiently. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing players to continuously recur spells from the graveyard. Overall, this Dimir Control deck aims to outlast opponents through resource management and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells with cascade, allowing you to cheat out powerful threats like Crashing Footfalls and Shardless Agent for free. The deck is built around creating a fast and aggressive board presence while disrupting your opponent's game plan using cards like Force of Negation and Bonecrusher Giant. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent before they have a chance to stabilize, ultimately leading to victory through relentless pressure.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating value through recursion, card advantage, and efficient removal. It also utilizes the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value and flexibility. The deck aims to play a long game, outlasting the opponent's threats and eventually overwhelming them with powerful planeswalkers, creatures, and removal spells. The mana base is well-balanced to support the deck's multicolored spells and provide consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a variety of powerful cards to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. The deck includes key cards such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six, alongside versatile creatures like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Seasoned Pyromancer. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad adds an extra element of value by blinking permanents for additional ETB effects. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats, while the mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's plan of controlling the game.

The deck focuses on using the Death's Shadow mechanic to quickly drop the player's life total in order to make the creature stronger. This deck also relies on efficient removal spells and disruptive hand disruption cards to control the board while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration, the deck ensures consistent card advantage and selection. The use of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value by allowing the player to recur key cards from their graveyard.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle by utilizing efficient threats and disruption spells. It aims to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six to generate value and control the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes a good mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and eventually winning through a powerful finisher like Teferi or a big Supreme Verdict. The mana base is optimized to support the control elements of the deck while also providing flexibility and consistency in casting spells. The companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, provides an additional advantage and synergizes well with the overall game plan of the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to put pressure on the opponent quickly, while also using cards like Death's Shadow and Kroxa to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing the player to recast key creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the board through disruption like Thoughtseize and Drown in the Loch, while also having the potential for explosive plays with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler.

The deck aims to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of powerful planeswalkers, removal spells, and card advantage engines. It focuses on generating value through recurring spells and creatures, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and versatility in gameplay. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolor requirements, while also providing access to a variety of powerful lands to further solidify its control over the battlefield.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively and leveraging the "Death's Shadow" mechanic to deploy powerful threats early in the game. It uses cards like "Thoughtseize" and "Inquisition of Kozilek" to disrupt the opponent's game plan while controlling the board with spells like "Drown in the Loch" and removal like "Fatal Push" and "Lightning Bolt." The deck also utilizes cards like "Lurrus of the Dream-Den" and "Mishra's Bauble" for card advantage and repeatable value. Overall, the strategy revolves around maximizing the power of Death's Shadow and overwhelming the opponent with efficient threats and disruption.

This deck focuses on leveraging the power of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Tarmogoyf, combined with disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The presence of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay helps in dealing with threats on the opposing side. Additionally, the inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Wrenn and Six provides card advantage and deck manipulation. The deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats and disruption to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.
